subject: Re: [junit] Stack overflow error
msgSnippet: ... StackOverflowError usually means you have a method invoking itself. Is your suite() method invoking itself? -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software
messageBody:
shyam wrote:
>
> dear group members,
> I am getting the followin error when i try to
> invoke the suite();
> unable to invoke
> suite()-java.lang.stackoverflowerror.
> how do i rectify that. if im not incorporating the
> test methods in the suite and not defining the suite
> its working well but i need to put it in a suite.help
> me out.thanks

StackOverflowError usually means you have a method invoking itself. Is
your suite() method invoking itself?
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
